intro: Polygonum ciliinode f. erectum, commonly known as the upright-leaf smartweed, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, ciliate (fringed) leaves. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in dense clusters, typically in late summer. It thrives in moist soils and is often found in wetlands, ditches, and along stream banks.
